values.value: GLBA Privacy Rule (16 CFR Part 313) requires financial institutions to provide initial privacy notices to customers and annual privacy notices thereafter. Organizations must track notice distribution, manage opt-out requests, and maintain audit trails of privacy notice compliance.
GLBA Privacy Rule 16 CFR Part 313.4 - Initial Privacy Notice, Part 313.5 - Annual Privacy Notice

1. Implement privacy notice tracking system for all customers. 2. Send initial privacy notices to new customers within required timeframe. 3. Schedule and send annual privacy notices to all customers. 4. Process and track opt-out requests from customers. 5. Maintain audit trail of all privacy notices sent and opt-out requests received. 6. Review and update privacy notices when information sharing practices change.
